website_summaries.verdict: The Lenovo Erazer X700 is a fairly good entry-level gaming desktop in its own right, but unlike competing systems, it also boasts liquid cooling, simple overclocking, and plenty of opportunities to dip a toe into the murky waters of upgrading and tweaking PCs.
pros: Built-in liquid cooling and OneKey Overclocking
Better than average bundled keyboard and mouse
Combination of solid-state drive and hard drive offers zippy performance and lots of space
cons: Third-generation processor and middle-of-the-road GPU offer good, but not great, performance

customer_reviews.title: Fast and easy to upgrade.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this system for light video processing, photos, the internet, and word processing. It replaced a 5 year old quad core system. The new system reduced video rendering time from over night to less than an hour in my tests. I did not like the pre-loaded bloat-ware and I am a little annoyed with Windows 8 (free upgrade to 8.1), but I can learn to work around those issues. With the easy access case it was a breeze to replace the DVD burner with a BD burner.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Bad to non existent customer support
customer_reviews.text: Lenovo's support is really bad! I contacted them several times to ask about issues I have with updating the BIOS and no answer at all! When I asked the question on social media on Lenovo's page, all they replied with was that they felt really sorry. ugh!!
